did.abstract: The New York Marxist School, now part of the Brecht Forum, was founded iIn 1975 to promote the study and renewal of Marxist ideas and their application to contemporary issues. The collection contains minutes, reports, curricula, catalogs, course syllabi and reading materials, programs, newsletters, Marxist Education Collective documents, materials of the school's Science Task Force; materials about the Grenada revolution and its overthrow; Philadelphia Marxist School materials; topical files, including files on the World Trade Center Trial, and files on several countries.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: In 1975, a group of civil rights, community, labor, and student activists came together to found the New York Marxist School, now a part of the larger Brecht Forum,a left political, culutral and educational center in New York City. A leading role was played by Arthur Felberbaum (1935-1979), earlier a Trotskyist activist. The NYMS sought to promote the study and renewal of Marxist ideas and their application to contemporary issues.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains early Marxist School documents; minutes, reports, curricula, catalogs, course syllabi and reading materials, programs, newsletters, public events documents, Marxist Education Collective documents, including conference materials; materials about the Grenada revolution and its overthrow, including tapes and slides; Science Task Force materials; Philadelphia Marxist School materials; topical files (political economy, Russian Revolution, etc.); files on several countries, including Cuba, El Salvador, Portugal, Puerto Rico, etc.; Women's movement materials; cultural magazines; and files on the World Trade Center Trial. A preliminary box level inventory follows:
Box 4. Grenada Tapes; Leaflets – all; special events materials; picnics, dinners, A.F. Awards Dinner
Box 5. Puerto Rico; Cuba; El Salvador; Portugal; Africa; East Timor; Tapes – Puerto Rico/F.M.L.N.
Box 6. Early Marxist School documents; CWA Local 1180; pre-school; "alternate summer" school ; Marxist Education Collective; assorted publications
Box 8. Course catalogs; Marxist Education Conference; events; Marxist Education Collective; women's movement and women's study group
Box 9. Marxist Education Collective; Discussion Bulletins; Open the Books; Prisoner Project; Philadelphia Marxist School; Viva Portugal! screening; Board of Directors
Box 10. Internal documents: minutes, history & perspective, splits; Portugal; Arthur’s tour; Arthur’s death; Marxist Education Collective; fundraising
Box 11. Leaflets; programs; topics; board minutes; curriculum; fundraising; Guatemala
Box 12. Special programs; by-laws; retreats; movements; programs and materials re Communist Manifesto (150th Anniversary); 1998 Socialist Scholars Conference; executive committee minutes

Box 14. Science Task Force; working papers; science classes & materials; Readings on – imperialism, America in Question, theory of revolution; u.s. labor economy, race & class, nature of ussr, Russian revolution, money, debt
